events.message: The customer filed a claim after their vehicle was involved in a collision at an intersection, reporting damages to both cars.
The claim was categorised under Auto Accident after reviewing the initial report mentioning car and collision details.
An experienced claims agent was assigned to the case to ensure the customer receives timely assistance with their vehicle accident.
The insurance company acknowledged receipt of the claim and informed the customer about the next steps in the evaluation process.
Documents such as the police report, photos of the vehicle damage, and a repair estimate were requested from the claimant.
The claimant submitted all requested documents including signed statements, police report, and photos confirming the extent of damage.
An investigation team began reviewing the submitted documents, photos, and contacted witnesses to validate the circumstances of the accident.
The investigation was concluded successfully confirming the liability and assessing the damage to the claimant’s vehicle.
A provisional settlement amount was proposed to the claimant based on the repair costs and assessed damages from the accident.
The claimant expressed satisfaction with the prompt communication and clarity in the settlement proposal related to their auto accident claim.
The claim was officially approved by the claims manager after all documentation and investigation results were verified.
The approved settlement payment was issued and transferred to the claimant’s account to cover the vehicle repair costs.
Following the payment issuance, the claim was officially closed with confirmation sent to the claimant expressing gratitude for their cooperation.
All related documents and case files for the auto accident claim were archived in compliance with company retention policies.
